alert.note: Alert for Smith (Mississippi) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued April 05 at 7:32AM CDT until April 05 at 7:45AM CDT by NWS Jackson
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 745 AM CDT FOR SOUTHEASTERN SMITH AND NORTHEASTERN COVINGTON COUNTIES... At 732 AM CDT, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from near Bay Springs to near Collins, moving east at 50 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect damage to roofs, siding, and trees. These severe thunderstorms will remain over mainly rural areas of southeastern Smith and northeastern Covington Counties, including the following locations... Seminary. TORNADO...POSSIBLE HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...<.75 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 1100 AM CDT for central, southeastern and east central Mississippi. Remain alert for a possible tornado! Tornadoes can develop quickly from severe thunderstorms. If you spot a tornado go at once into the basement or small central room in a sturdy structure. For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building.
